ygData.subject: Stock Market
ygData.msgSnippet: Since this is getting some discussion, I had a thought to share... We all know that the stock market obeys some basic formula, modified by human psychology.

Since this is getting some discussion, I had a thought to share...

We all know that the stock market obeys some basic formula, modified
by human psychology.  Certain information, when it is promulgated,
causes a reaction in demand, which has an influence in the price. 
Looking at past performance then is only looking at half the
equation...

Now, this is probably an intractible thing to do, but what if...

Suppose you were to monitor the internet.  Monitor news stories,
articles, blogs, etc.  Feed that in (in some form or another) as
additional inputs to correlate with the numbers themselves.  Give the
network something besides the numbers themselves to use as indicators
of future behavior.  Let it learn the kinds of things that foreshadow
future rises or falls.  Then, as such things start to appear in the
communications, the algorithm is better equipped to predict the
fluctuations that are psychology driven instead of formula driven.

Just an idea. :)
